page.title: 15Hook/Skelton Railway Bridge
page.content: The railway bridge in{Hook}was built in{1868}.The bridge goes over the{ {River Ouse}.The{Hook}and{Skelton {railway Bridge}is made of cast iron.If ships want to go through they have to wait until the bridge swings open.The bridge is 253 metres long.In{1868}the bridge was{the second largest double- {line swing bridge in the World.} During both World Wars the bridge was the main crossing point from the north to the south coast and so was bombed by both Zeppelins and German Bombers. The{Hook and Skelton Railway Bridge has been damaged many times by ships. British rail was unable to claim compensation for its repair.By threatening to close the line between {Goole}and{Gilbedyke,}it prompted the local authority to pay just under Â£1 million towards its repair.The line has been saved and everyone is happy.
